page.title: 01LLANDYRNOG - GENERAL
page.content: { Llandyrnog is a small village {situated some 3 miles S.E. of Denbigh {in the Vale of Clwyd,North Wales. { }Geographically,it lies near the centre of the Vale of Clwyd, a rift valley formed by a long fault line on the East and a series of faults on the West. The area is rural with dairy farming on lush,cultivated fields predominating. Llandyrnog has one of the most modern milk factories in Europe. (see Industry) The population is approximately 400 and both Welsh and English is spoken (see Language) Llangwyfan Hospital closed down within the last decade (see local history)
